page.title: 03Alyth Perthshire
page.content: Newspaper reports suggest that upwards of twenty per cent of the raspberry crop was unable to be picked due to the lack of labour at the appropriate time. This year there were two events that brought Alyth to the notice of the rest of the country :- BBC Television decided to use Alyth as the setting for a period TV programme set in Scotland around 1950 and the choice was made as it was considered that there had been no drastic changes to the character of the town since then .My own experience is that the town is unspoiled by change since my earliest recollections when staying with my cousin the Rev Jacob Sibbald Clark in the High Manse and attending Alyth Public School in the 1940s.I await with excitement the screening of the programme as do many
